title: Geth RC2 hangs then dies
body:
Ubuntu 15.04. 

Started geth yesterday noon with just 'console' as param.

At around 12pm today I noticed the log had stopped moving this morning. Last entries were:

```
I0712 09:36:37.866160    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 4 txs in 8.197155ms. #867567 [be0f982e / be0f982e]
I0712 09:36:50.596072    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 107 txs in 120.954015ms. #867568 [3de782f1 / 3de782f1]
I0712 09:37:05.892378    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 97 txs in 98.100482ms. #867569 [5641503f / 5641503f]
I0712 09:37:22.822985    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 3 txs in 6.94241ms. #867570 [52745a84 / 52745a84]
I0712 09:37:29.132926    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 90 txs in 169.519712ms. #867571 [f8902764 / f8902764]
I0712 09:37:38.400074    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 38 txs in 115.612748ms. #867572 [98b51966 / 98b51966]
I0712 09:37:55.223821    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 131 txs in 181.456516ms. #867573 [41363d2e / 41363d2e]
I0712 09:38:24.444079    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 32 txs in 41.902965ms. #867574 [2cef0828 / 2cef0828]
I0712 09:38:28.214667    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 130 txs in 143.815941ms. #867575 [b0ead72d / b0ead72d]
I0712 09:38:42.332316    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 129 txs in 119.919167ms. #867569 [42b9ba62 / 42b9ba62]
I0712 09:39:22.712063    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 80 txs in 210.768007ms. #867576 [964245ec / 964245ec]
I0712 09:39:31.961773    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 79 txs in 315.587319ms. #867576 [d88c8ea4 / d88c8ea4]
I0712 09:39:41.982238    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 78 txs in 238.210586ms. #867576 [259f90f7 / 259f90f7]
I0712 09:40:01.876406    3343 chain_manager.go:671] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 79 txs in 225.759556ms. #867576 [30f5074f / 30f5074f]

> net
{
  listening: true,
  peerCount: 25,
  version: '0',
  addPeer: function (),
  getListening: function (),
  getPeerCount: function (),
  getVersion: function ()
}

```

System resources (mem usage looks v high)

```
top - 12:48:34 up 19:39,  3 users,  load average: 0.90, 1.09, 0.83
Tasks: 210 total,   1 running, 209 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
%Cpu(s):  1.7 us,  0.6 sy,  0.0 ni, 97.8 id,  0.0 wa,  0.0 hi,  0.0 si,  0.0 st
KiB Mem:   8116892 total,  7910208 used,   206684 free,    96888 buffers
KiB Swap:  8328188 total,   424804 used,  7903384 free.  6205708 cached Mem
```

I then tried to restart the process - exit didn't work so ctrl+c 10 times, this is the output of the panic that ensued:

http://pastebin.com/vN8CsjBX
I've completely wiped the gpu mining FAQ rig and reinstalled from scratch in order to isolate the issue. Currently testing.
ok got a setup running now and will observe if it hangs again.
